issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The schema for object storage uses the index name "IDX_bucket_uuid" for both bucket tags and lifecycle rules. Index names must be unique so one of these indexes will fail to create:

{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# \d eucalyptus_osg.bucket_tags
               Table "eucalyptus_osg.bucket_tags"
        Column         |            Type             | Modifiers 
-----------------------+-----------------------------+-----------
 id                    | character varying(255)      | not null
 creation_timestamp    | timestamp without time zone | 
 last_update_timestamp | timestamp without time zone | 
 metadata_perm_uuid    | character varying(255)      | not null
 version               | integer                     | 
 bucket_uuid           | character varying(255)      | 
 tag_key               | character varying(128)      | 
 tag_value             | character varying(256)      | 
Indexes:
    "bucket_tags_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "uk_5mg11hic48jfc3pm2d3x3estv" UNIQUE CONSTRAINT, btree (metadata_perm_uuid)
    "idx_bucket_uuid" btree (bucket_uuid)
{code}

{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# \d eucalyptus_osg.lifecycle_rules
               Table "eucalyptus_osg.lifecycle_rules"
          Column          |            Type             | Modifiers 
--------------------------+-----------------------------+-----------
 id                       | character varying(255)      | not null
 creation_timestamp       | timestamp without time zone | 
 last_update_timestamp    | timestamp without time zone | 
 metadata_perm_uuid       | character varying(255)      | not null
 version                  | integer                     | 
 bucket_uuid              | character varying(255)      | 
 enabled                  | boolean                     | 
 expiration_date          | timestamp without time zone | 
 expiration_days          | integer                     | 
 last_processing_start    | timestamp without time zone | 
 prefix                   | character varying(256)      | 
 rule_id                  | character varying(64)       | 
 transition_date          | timestamp without time zone | 
 transition_days          | integer                     | 
 transition_storage_class | character varying(255)      | 
Indexes:
    "lifecycle_rules_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "uk_ihwxgxltq9fd261ib74n8duq8" UNIQUE CONSTRAINT, btree (metadata_perm_uuid)
{code}

this may have some performance impact if there were large numbers of buckets.
fields.summary: OSG schema uses duplicate index names

comments.body:
Hi [~sjones],

In your lifecycle output above (and same for me), there is no "idx_bucket_uuid" index listed. I don't know why. It's not because the index name is already being used and therefore can't be re-used by Lifecycle. I see this in LifecycleRule.java:

{code:java}
@Table(name = "lifecycle_rules", indexes = {
    @Index(name = "IDX_bucket_uuid", columnList = "bucket_uuid")
})
{code}

...but the same code is in BucketTags.java:

{code:java}
@Table(name = "bucket_tags", indexes = {
    @Index(name = "IDX_bucket_uuid", columnList = "bucket_uuid")
})
{code}

...and it shows up in that table:

{noformat}
eucalyptus_shared=# \d eucalyptus_osg.bucket_tags
               Table "eucalyptus_osg.bucket_tags"
        Column         |            Type             | Modifiers
-----------------------+-----------------------------+-----------
 id                    | character varying(255)      | not null
 creation_timestamp    | timestamp without time zone |
 last_update_timestamp | timestamp without time zone |
 metadata_perm_uuid    | character varying(255)      | not null
 version               | integer                     |
 bucket_uuid           | character varying(255)      |
 tag_key               | character varying(128)      |
 tag_value             | character varying(256)      |
Indexes:
    "bucket_tags_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "uk_5mg11hic48jfc3pm2d3x3estv" UNIQUE CONSTRAINT, btree (metadata_perm_uuid)
    "idx_bucket_uuid" btree (bucket_uuid)
{noformat}

In my new CORS code, it's a different index name, and it shows up in the table output:

{noformat}
eucalyptus_shared=# \d eucalyptus_osg.cors_rules
                Table "eucalyptus_osg.cors_rules"
        Column         |            Type             | Modifiers
-----------------------+-----------------------------+-----------
 id                    | character varying(255)      | not null
 creation_timestamp    | timestamp without time zone |
 last_update_timestamp | timestamp without time zone |
 metadata_perm_uuid    | character varying(255)      | not null
 version               | integer                     |
 allowed_headers_json  | character varying(255)      |
 allowed_methods_json  | character varying(255)      |
 allowed_origins_json  | character varying(255)      |
 bucket_uuid           | character varying(255)      |
 expose_headers_json   | character varying(255)      |
 max_age_seconds       | integer                     |
 rule_id               | character varying(255)      |
 sequence              | integer                     |
Indexes:
    "cors_rules_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "uk_ppu1rdtriaxqxpmyqjxf3kee6" UNIQUE CONSTRAINT, btree (metadata_perm_uuid)
    "idx_cors_bucket_uuid" btree (bucket_uuid)
{noformat}

I can easily change the index name for Lifecycle and BucketTags, but first I'd like to understand why the Lifecycle index is missing and BucketTags isn't.
Started analysis, but may need to be re-assigned during my absence in 4.3.

This is from /var/log/eucalyptus/postgresql-Fri.log on a recent build:

{code}
2016-04-15 10:29:56 PDTERROR:  relation "idx_bucket_uuid" already exists
2016-04-15 10:29:56 PDTSTATEMENT:  create index IDX_bucket_uuid on eucalyptus_osg.lifecycle_rules (bucket_uuid)
{code}

resulting table:

{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# \d eucalyptus_osg.lifecycle_rules
               Table "eucalyptus_osg.lifecycle_rules"
          Column          |            Type             | Modifiers 
--------------------------+-----------------------------+-----------
 id                       | character varying(255)      | not null
 creation_timestamp       | timestamp without time zone | 
 last_update_timestamp    | timestamp without time zone | 
 metadata_perm_uuid       | character varying(255)      | not null
 version                  | integer                     | 
 bucket_uuid              | character varying(255)      | 
 enabled                  | boolean                     | 
 expiration_date          | timestamp without time zone | 
 expiration_days          | integer                     | 
 last_processing_start    | timestamp without time zone | 
 prefix                   | character varying(256)      | 
 rule_id                  | character varying(64)       | 
 transition_date          | timestamp without time zone | 
 transition_days          | integer                     | 
 transition_storage_class | character varying(255)      | 
Indexes:
    "lifecycle_rules_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "uk_ihwxgxltq9fd261ib74n8duq8" UNIQUE CONSTRAINT, btree (metadata_perm_uuid)
{code}

Changed BucketTags.java index to IDX_bucket_tags_bucket_uuid.
Changed LifecycleRule.java index to IDX_lifecycle_bucket_uuid.
commit 118bfe6502b0299c53cf1200d9cff4975940f6c7
We should verify (QA) on upgrade to 4.3 that the tables ( eucalyptus_osg.bucket_tags, eucalyptus_osg.lifecycle_rules ) do not have duplicate indexes on bucket_uuid.
[~sjones], I'd think we would need to create upgrade script to drop old index.
Still being worked for the upgrade code part of this issue.
[~sjones] Based on your comment in EUCA-12364 just now, should I (also) have a @EntityUpgrade step in addition to my @PreUpgrade step? I'm deleting an index, not changing any data.

[~lincoln.thomas], @PreUpgrade will run on upgrade when necessary as per the declared version. The JPA @PreUpdate annotation is what I was referring to on the other issue (though I incorrectly said pre-persist)
Per [~sjones], changing {{since = v4_1_0}} to {{since = v4_3_0}}. I had misunderstood that to mean the first version to upgrade _from_, not the first version to upgrade _to_.

Commit 3f8e5627c2ff2582f89a8420f54984fb593f564a

After upgrade from released 4.2.2 to latest master, we see the new indices {{idx_bucket_tags_bucket_uuid, idx_cors_bucket_uuid, idx_lifecycle_bucket_uuid}} and no more {{idx_bucket_uuid}}.

{noformat}
[root@d-03 yum.repos.d]# psql -h /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/ -p 8777 eucalyptus_shared
psql (9.2.8)
Type "help" for help.

eucalyptus_shared=# set search_path = "eucalyptus_osg";
SET
eucalyptus_shared=# \di
                                   List of relations
     Schema     |             Name             | Type  |   Owner    |       Table
----------------+------------------------------+-------+------------+-------------------
 eucalyptus_osg | bucket_tags_pkey             | index | eucalyptus | bucket_tags
 eucalyptus_osg | buckets_pkey                 | index | eucalyptus | buckets
 eucalyptus_osg | cors_rules_pkey              | index | eucalyptus | cors_rules
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_bucket_tags_bucket_uuid  | index | eucalyptus | bucket_tags
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_cors_bucket_uuid         | index | eucalyptus | cors_rules
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_lifecycle_bucket_uuid    | index | eucalyptus | lifecycle_rules
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_object_key               | index | eucalyptus | objects
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_object_uuid              | index | eucalyptus | objects
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_part_uuid                | index | eucalyptus | parts
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_version_id               | index | eucalyptus | objects
{ ... }
{noformat}

verified. No duplicate indices are found after upgrade.
eucalyptus_shared=# \di
                                   List of relations
     Schema     |             Name             | Type  |   Owner    |       Table       
----------------+------------------------------+-------+------------+-------------------
 eucalyptus_osg | bucket_tags_pkey             | index | eucalyptus | bucket_tags
 eucalyptus_osg | buckets_pkey                 | index | eucalyptus | buckets
 eucalyptus_osg | cors_rules_pkey              | index | eucalyptus | cors_rules
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_bucket_tags_bucket_uuid  | index | eucalyptus | bucket_tags
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_cors_bucket_uuid         | index | eucalyptus | cors_rules
 eucalyptus_osg | idx_lifecycle_bucket_uuid    | index | eucalyptus | lifecycle_rules

In addition, ls of 1000 buckets after upgrade is fast.
